title: Bug 12906 - Cannot open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906 - When a file is already opened in one editor, it should give an error message if you try to open it in another editor.
OB: Currently, if a file is already opened in one editor, there is no warning or error message when trying to open it in another editor.
EB: However, there should be a warning message or error message displayed when attempting to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:

1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by simply double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Now, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.

Currently, nothing happens when performing this step. However, the workbench should display a warning message saying that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message stating that you should close all files first.

We believe this is a safety feature where the WSAD (Workspace App Development) doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
